column4: how to disable gui splash screen? want to see the boot process in text mode , cause my video card/monitor says out of range.
i have no way of telling what the status is, cause screen out of range
help
does it say refresh rate out of range?
let me check, bu t i think the resoultion is wrong, my screen support 1024x and default probably bigger
well what happened, was this the first time. did you edit something.
just installed it on dual boot. monitor says "out of range", it's not a message from the console. it's a message from  my LCD screen itself.
oh no. unable to boot into ubuntu. i have in intitial ram disk prompt

i know. it usually means wrong resolution or bad refresh rates. if you can do ctrl+alt+f2 and get a terminal you can try "sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg" and it should rebuild it to the correct settings. otherwise you may be able to get a terminal with recovery mode boot
it happens when booting linux right
yes during boot time, no splash screen. but bigger right problem now.  some sort of tty device error
can you boot to recovery mode.
i have all in one budget motherboard combo. so lots of hardware are very rare
let me try.
hm.. recovery mode is stuck or maybe taking a long time. anyway. i will try slackware and see if i get more luck. i think the main thing is the drivers for my budget motherboard
well if you get recovery to work do the command i gave you earier
okie dok
nope. failed. tty error can't access control. i still get initial ram disk prompt. i'll give slackware a try later this week =(
hmm thats too bad. did ubuntu ever start up. maybe had something to with dualboot
no, don't think it's dualboot prob. i am running ubuntu on laptop. the one with problem is my bundled-budget-motherboard-desktop.
hmm. i donr know what to say. its beyond me :(
it's beyond me too. but i'll keep trying until i find a distro that will work with my desktop. i am only using it as web/file server. so no biggy
